pullRequest.body:
There are many interesting infinite root systems, so we remove the finiteness assumption from the definition.  A few results use finiteness unnecessarily, so their proofs are revised.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: :v: ScottCarnahan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7887706299/job/21523598956)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7887706299/job/21523598017)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7887706299/job/21523598652)

```suggestion
  repeat exact fun x _ => Module.involutive_reflection (P.coroot_root_two i) x
```
if you like it!

```suggestion
lemma reflection_self (x : M) : P.reflection i (P.reflection i x) = x :=
```
maybe?  I am not a naming expert.

Alternatively
```suggestion
  constructor <;>
    exact fun x _ => Module.involutive_reflection (P.coroot_root_two i) x
```

We generally use `self` when a variable `x` occurs in two places, and `of_same` when there is `i`, `j` and an assumption `h : i = j`.
```suggestion
lemma coreflection_self (x : N) : P.coreflection i (P.coreflection i x) = x :=
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LinearAlgebra/RootSystem/Basic): rm finiteness from def
